name: Amazon AWS
description: AWS provides a comprehensive suite of cloud computing services, including compute, storage, and GPU solutions for diverse workloads.

features.title: Global Infrastructure
features.description: Extensive network of data centers across multiple regions worldwide

features.title: Pay-as-you-go Pricing
features.description: Flexible pricing model with no upfront commitments required

features.title: Advanced Security
features.description: Comprehensive security tools and compliance certifications

features.title: Auto Scaling
features.description: Automatically adjust resources based on demand

features.title: Integrated Services
features.description: Extensive ecosystem of services that work seamlessly together

features.title: Developer Tools
features.description: Comprehensive suite of tools for development, deployment, and management

pros: Broad range of compute options including GPUs
Pay-as-you-go pricing with cost optimization tools
Extensive global network of data centers
Rich ecosystem of integrated services and tools
cons: Steep learning curve for new users
Potential for unexpected costs without proper management

gettingStarted.title: Sign up for AWS
gettingStarted.description: Create an AWS account to access the cloud platform.

gettingStarted.title: Choose a compute service
gettingStarted.description: Select from EC2, Lambda, or container services based on your workload needs.

gettingStarted.title: Launch an instance
gettingStarted.description: Configure and launch your first compute instance or container.

gettingStarted.title: Set up security
gettingStarted.description: Configure security groups and access controls for your resources.

gettingStarted.title: Monitor and optimize
gettingStarted.description: Use AWS CloudWatch and Compute Optimizer to monitor performance and reduce costs.

computeServices.name: Amazon EC2
computeServices.description: Virtual servers in the cloud with a wide range of instance types.

instanceTypes.name: P4 Instances
instanceTypes.description: Powered by NVIDIA A100 Tensor Core GPUs, optimized for AI and HPC workloads.
features: Up to 8 NVIDIA A100 GPUs per instance
600 GB/s GPU-to-GPU bandwidth with NVSwitch
Elastic Fabric Adapter (EFA) for low-latency, multi-node GPU training
Network throughput of up to 400 Gbps

instanceTypes.name: P3 Instances
instanceTypes.description: Equipped with NVIDIA V100 Tensor Core GPUs for deep learning and HPC.
features: Up to 8 NVIDIA V100 GPUs per instance
300 GB/s GPU-to-GPU bandwidth with NVLink
Suitable for FP16 and FP32 precision workloads

instanceTypes.name: G5 Instances
instanceTypes.description: Powered by NVIDIA A10G GPUs for graphics-intensive applications.
features: Optimized for real-time ray tracing and AI-driven graphics
Suitable for game streaming and content creation

instanceTypes.name: P5 Instances
instanceTypes.description: Powered by NVIDIA H100 Tensor Core GPUs for next‑gen AI and HPC.
features: Up to 8 NVIDIA H100 GPUs per instance
Amazon EC2 UltraClusters scale to tens of thousands of H100 GPUs
Up to 3,200 Gbps aggregate networking with EFA and GPUDirect RDMA

instanceTypes.name: G6 Instances
instanceTypes.description: Powered by NVIDIA L4 Tensor Core GPUs for graphics, video, and inference.
features: Up to 8 NVIDIA L4 GPUs per instance (24 GB per GPU)
Fractional GPU sizes down to 1/8 of an L4
Up to 192 vCPUs and 7.5 TB local NVMe

instanceTypes.name: G6e Instances
instanceTypes.description: Powered by NVIDIA L40S GPUs for advanced AI inference and 3D workloads.
features: Up to 8 NVIDIA L40S GPUs per instance (48 GB per GPU)
Up to 400 Gbps networking and 1.5 TB system memory
Ideal for LLM serving, diffusion, and digital twins

computeServices.name: Amazon ECS
features: Support for Docker containers
Integration with other AWS services
Automated cluster management and scheduling

computeServices.name: Amazon EKS
computeServices.description: Managed Kubernetes service for container orchestration.
features: Certified Kubernetes conformant
Integrates with AWS networking and security services
Supports both EC2 and Fargate launch types

computeServices.name: AWS Lambda
computeServices.description: Serverless compute service for running code without managing servers.
features: Automatic scaling and high availability
Pay only for compute time consumed
Supports multiple programming languages

gpuServices.name: EC2 GPU Instances
gpuServices.description: EC2 instances equipped with powerful GPUs for compute-intensive workloads.

types.name: P3 Instances
types.bestFor: Deep learning training and inference, scientific simulations

types.name: G5 Instances
types.bestFor: Graphics rendering, game streaming, machine learning inference

gpuServices.name: Amazon SageMaker
gpuServices.description: Fully managed machine learning platform with GPU support.
features: Integrated Jupyter notebooks with GPU acceleration
Automated model tuning and deployment
Built-in algorithms optimized for GPU execution

pricingOptions.name: On-Demand Instances
pricingOptions.description: Pay for compute capacity by the second with no long-term commitments.

pricingOptions.name: Spot Instances
pricingOptions.description: Use spare EC2 capacity at up to 90% off the On-Demand price.

pricingOptions.name: Reserved Instances
pricingOptions.description: Save up to 72% compared to On-Demand pricing with a 1 or 3-year commitment.

pricingOptions.name: Savings Plans
pricingOptions.description: Save up to 72% on compute usage with a 1 or 3-year commitment to a consistent amount of usage.

support: Basic (free), Developer, Business, Enterprise support plans with varying response times and features. Extensive documentation, forums, and training resources.
tagline: Comprehensive cloud platform with global reach
